title: Science & Nature - Beginner
description: Basic science concepts covering biology, chemistry, and physics

questions.question: What do plants need to make their own food?
questions.explanation: Plants use sunlight and carbon dioxide for photosynthesis to make their own food.

questions.question: How many bones are in the adult human body?
questions.explanation: An adult human has 206 bones in their body.

questions.question: What is the chemical symbol for water?
questions.explanation: Water's chemical formula is H2O, representing two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom.

questions.question: Which planet is closest to the Sun?
questions.explanation: Mercury is the closest planet to the Sun in our solar system.

questions.question: What gas do humans breathe in?
questions.explanation: Humans breathe in oxygen, which is essential for cellular respiration.

questions.question: What is the largest mammal in the world?
questions.explanation: The blue whale is the largest mammal and the largest animal ever known to have lived on Earth.

questions.question: At what temperature does water freeze?
questions.explanation: Water freezes at 0°C (32°F) under normal atmospheric pressure.

questions.question: What is the center of an atom called?
questions.explanation: The nucleus is the dense center of an atom, containing protons and neutrons.

questions.question: Which organ pumps blood through the human body?
questions.explanation: The heart is a muscular organ that pumps blood throughout the body.

questions.question: What causes seasons on Earth?
questions.explanation: Earth's seasons are caused by the planet's tilted axis as it orbits the Sun.
